Interesting. It can go either way, but here's what I can tell you. I knew for all of my children when my LMP was and so we dated from there, but my ultrasounds showed 2-3 days earlier and my OB said he does not change the EDD unless it's a week or more different and then they would use the ultraosund date. So seeing your ultrasound date puts you at 12/14 and you were guesstimating on your LMP I would say go with the 12/14 as it is an 8 day difference.You mentioned measuring 1 cm ahead of how many weeks you are - I did for all of mine, but I had BIG babies (and no diabetes either) - my oldest was 9lbs. 9 oz. 8 days past EDD, my middle one was 9lbs. 15 oz. 1 day before EDD an dmy last one was 10lbs. 4 oz. 1 day before EDD. Again I would go with the ultraosund date, but if your Dr. won't then they will do things according to the 12/22 EDD. Have you told your Dr. that you are not 100% sure of when your LMP was? Good luck with everything =)

Your due date is when the baby decides when it is ready to come out. No one can predict when the baby will  come into this world. The dates are just a guess. It  is like when you should be ready and have everything prepared. That is all. Good luck!!

question: My doctor is sticking with Dec 22nd 2011 as my due date because I estimated the first day of my last period was march 17,2011 (although i'm not sure) BUT my ultrasound dated December 14, 2011. Should I listen to my doctor or my ultrasound? I know neither are actually pin point accurate, but which should I count on?  Since she says my due date is December 22 she says im about 30 weeks and 1 day, but I'm measuring 1cm ahead. Doesn't it make sense that I am actually 31 weeks and  2 days going with the December 14th due date?
title: Doctor's Date or Ultrasound Date?
